newsitem.title: USA: US spot jet ends slump, rises on NYMEX and diffs.
newsitem.headline: US spot jet ends slump, rises on NYMEX and diffs.

text.p: U.S. spot jet fuel prices ended a four-day slump late Wednesday as NYMEX heating oil futures finally settled higher and differentials firmed in the Gulf Coast on refinery buying, traders said.
U.S. Gulf (USG) prompt 54-grade jet fuel was bid at 1.50 cents below February futures, a full cent firmer than Tuesday values, players said.

"A major came in and bought two (Gulf) cargoes, one for the East Coast and one for the West Coast," a Gulf trader said, adding the buys also helped firm differentials on low-sulfur 55-grade material about 0.75 cent to 1.10 cents below the print.
Meanwhile, February heating oil futures settled 0.86 cent higher, reversing direction after losing over 5.0 cents since late Wednesday.
New York Harbor 54-grade saw diffs hold fairly steady at 2.10 cents above the screen, players said.
